public abstract class RestService extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent implements com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable
Base class for KivaKit microservice REST applications.

Mounting Request Handlers

(MicroservletRequest handlers must be installed with mount(Version, String, HttpMethod, Class), or mount(String, HttpMethod, Class). All calls to mount request handlers must be made in the Microservice.onInitialize() method. Attempting to mount a handler outside of Microservice.onInitialize() will result in a runtime error. For example:

In this microservice: 

 public class MyMicroservice extends Microservice<Void>
 {
     public MicroserviceMetadata metadata()
     {
         return new MicroserviceMetadata()
             .withName("my-microservice")
             .withDescription("My microservice")
             .withVersion(Version.of(1, 0));
     }

         [...]
 }

this call to mount(Version, String, HttpMethod, Class) in onInitialize(): 

 public class MyRestService extends RestService
 {
         [...]

     public void onInitialize()
     {
         var v1 = Version.of(1, 0);

         mount(v1, "/users/update", POST, UpdateUserRequest.class);
     }
 }

would mount the POST request handler UserUpdateRequest on the URL /my-microservice/api/1.0/users/update.

API Forwarding - Backwards Compatibility

To make it easy to support previous API versions, JAR Resources can be launched in a child process using a command-line switch. KivaKit will redirect requests for the previous version to the child process on a specific port on the local host. This ensures full compatibility with the old API with a minimum of effort. This can be accomplished by simply including one or more JAR files in a package inside the microservice JAR (or in a folder somewhere), and then using the -api-forwarding command line switch:

-api-forwarding=[version],[jar],[port],[command-line];[...].

For example: 

-api-forwarding=version=0.9,jar=classpath:/apis/my-microservice-0.9.jar,port=8082,command-line=-deployment=development

Would mount the 0.9 API JAR in the package apis on port 8082, and the 1.0 API JAR in the package apis on port 8083. Any ResourceIdentifier can be used to specify the JAR resource. The example here uses the classpath scheme, so the JAR will be located on the classpath. See ResourceIdentifier for details regarding available resource resolvers and their associated schemes.

If more control is desired, mountApi(Version, Resource, String, int) can be used to manually mount the API JAR for a previous version of the API on the given port number on the local host.

OpenAPI

The openApiInfo() class can optionally be overridden to provide OpenAPI details beyond those provided by the Microservice via MicroserviceMetadata.

API Paths and Versions

The path to a particular API version can be customized by overriding versionToPath(Version), and pathToVersion(String) (both must be overridden). By default this format used by both methods is /api/[major-version].[minor-version]. For example, /api/1.0.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public final void initialize()
      Mount OpenAPI request handler and initialize the rest service. This method cannot be overridden. Override Initializable.onInitialize() instead.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable

    • microservice

      public Microservice<?> microservice()
      Returns the microservice to which this rest service belongs

    • mount

      public void mount(RestPath path, Microservlet<?,?> microservlet)
      Mounts the given microservlet on the given path
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the microservlet. If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/". For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      microservlet - The microservlet to mount

    • mount

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest, Response extends MicroservletResponse> void mount(com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version version, String path, com.telenav.kivakit.network.http.HttpMethod method, Class<Request> requestType)
      Mounts the given request handler on the path /api/[version]/path
      Parameters:
      version - The version of the request handler
      path - The path to mount on
      method - The HTTP method
      requestType - The type of the request handler

    • mount

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest, Response extends MicroservletResponse> void mount(String path, com.telenav.kivakit.network.http.HttpMethod method, Class<Request> requestType)
      Mounts the given request class on the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the given microservlet request handler (requestType). If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/", where the version is retrieved from Application.version(). For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      method - The HTTP method to which the microservlet should respond
      requestType - The type of the request

    • mountAllOn

      public void mountAllOn(MicroservletMountTarget target)
      Not public API

      Mounts all paths that have been mounted on this REST service on the given mount target.

    • mountApi

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest, Response extends MicroservletResponse> void mountApi(com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version version, com.telenav.kivakit.resource.Resource jar, String commandLine, int port)
      Mounts the given JAR on the path specified by versionToPath(Version). Requests to the path will be directed to a child process running the JAR. This permits greater agility with strong backwards compatibility (at the expense of some memory and compute resources).
      Parameters:
      version - The API version in the JAR file
      jar - The JAR file to launch in a child process
      commandLine - The command line to use when executing the JAR
      port - The port to talk to the child process

    • mountApi

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest, Response extends MicroservletResponse> void mountApi(com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version version, String path, com.telenav.kivakit.resource.Resource jar, String commandLine, int port)
      Mounts the given JAR on the given path for the given HTTP method. Requests to the path will be directed to a child process running the JAR. This permits greater agility with strong backwards compatibility (at the expense of some memory and compute resources).
      Parameters:
      version - The API version in the JAR file
      path - The path to the given JAR. If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/", where the version is retrieved from Application.version(). For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      jar - The JAR file to delegate to
      commandLine - The command line to use when executing the JAR
      port - The port to talk to the child process

    • pathToVersion

      protected com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version pathToVersion(String path)
      Extracts any version from the given path, which must be in the format produced by versionToPath(Version).
      Parameters:
      path - The path containing version information
      Returns:
      The version

    • rootPath

      protected final String rootPath()
      Returns the root path under which the API is mounted. By default, this is /[microservice-name] (slash), which means the API root path for version 1.0 would be /[microservice-name]/api/1.0. This method can be overridden to put the API root under a microservice-specific path. For example, returning / as the root path would result in this base URL for version 1.0 of the API: /api/1.0
      Returns:
      The root path under which the API is found

    • versionToPath

      protected String versionToPath(com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version version)
      Returns the absolute API path. By default, this is /api/[major-version].[minor-version]
      Parameters:
      version - The API version
      Returns:
      The path to the APi for the given version
